Package jeroquest.units

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
jeroquest.units.Character
jeroquest.units.Monster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Piece, GraphicElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
Goblin, Mummy
public abstract class Monster
extends Character
Programming Methodology Practice. Jeroquest - An example of Object Oriented Programming. Class Monster - abstract class that represents the monsters in the game
Author:
Jorge Puente Peinador y Ramiro Varela Arias, Juan Luis Mateo

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Monster​(java.lang.String name, int movement, int attack, int defence, int body)
    Create a monster from its name and initial values for the attributes, initially its position is null (outside of the board)

  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster​(java.lang.String name, int movement, int attack, int defence, int body)
      Create a monster from its name and initial values for the attributes, initially its position is null (outside of the board)
      Parameters:
      name - name of the character
      movement - squares to move per turn
      attack - dices to roll for an attack without a weapon
      defence - dices to roll for the defence
      body - initial life

  • Method Details

    • defend

      public int defend​(int impacts)
      The monster defends itself from an attack (Implementation of an abstract inherited method)
      Specified by:
      defend in class Character
      Parameters:
      impacts - the total number of impacts to try to block or suffer
      Returns:
      the number of suffered wounds

    • isEnemy

      public boolean isEnemy​(Character c)
      Check if the character given as argument is an enemy of the current one. An enemy will be all characters that are monsters (Overridden method)
      Overrides:
      isEnemy in class Character
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if it an enemy of the current character
